name: Secure Data Management
description: This Knowledge Unit (KU) focuses on the principles and practices of secure data management. It includes the collection, storage, protection, and governance of data, with an emphasis on ensuring data integrity, confidentiality, and availability.
outcomes: Identify types of data and common data formats used in secure data management.
Recall basic concepts and terminology related to data security and privacy.
Explain the importance of secure data management in organizational contexts.
Describe the principles of data governance and compliance with regulations.
Implement techniques for secure data collection, storage, and processing.
Apply data protection methods, including encryption and access controls.
Analyze data security risks and vulnerabilities in different data management scenarios.
Evaluate the effectiveness of data protection measures.
Assess compliance with data protection laws and regulations.
Critique data management practices for potential security improvements.
Develop a data management plan that includes security measures and compliance strategies.
Design data protection protocols tailored to specific organizational needs.
topics: Definition and Importance of Data Management
Common Data Formats (JSON, XML, CSV, etc.)
Secure Storage Solutions (Databases, Data Lakes, Cloud Storage)
Compliance with Data Protection Regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)
Analysis of Data Breaches and Lessons Learned
Best Practices in Secure Data Management
Developing a Secure Data Management Plan
Components of a Data Management Plan
Steps to Create and Implement the Plan
notes: Special instructions or explanations: Emphasize the practical application of data management techniques., Include real-world examples and case studies to illustrate key concepts., Highlight the importance of regulatory and ethical considerations in data management.
